conclusion: Analyze the p-V diagram and use properties of an ideal gas.
Cycle ABCDA is a square cycle with each side representing a different thermodynamic process.
AB is a constant volume process (isochoric).
BC is a constant pressure process (isobaric).
CD is a constant volume process (isochoric).
DA is a constant pressure process (isobaric).
In isochoric process AB, work done is zero: W_AB = 0.
In isobaric process BC, work done is W_BC = P2(V2 - V1).
In isochoric process CD, work done is zero: W_CD = 0.
In isobaric process DA, work done is W_DA = P1(V1 - V2).
Net work done in cycle: W_net = (P2 - P1)(V2 - V1).
First law of thermodynamics: Q = ΔU + W.
Heat in isochoric process: Q = nC_V ΔT.
In isochoric process, ΔU = nC_V ΔT and W = 0, so Q_net = nC_V ΔT.
Temperature at state B is T_B = T_A = T_0.
